detaileddescription.para:
*src
points to the input vector.
*dst
points to the output vector.
size
size of the vectors.
The Q31 value INT32_MIN (0x80000000) will be saturated to the maximum allowable positive value INT32_MAX.

*src
points to the input vector.
*dst
points to the output vector.
size
size of the vectors.
The Q15 value INT16_MIN (0x8000) will be saturated to the maximum allowable positive value INT16_MAX.

points to the input vector.
*dst

size
size of the vectors.
The Q7 value INT8_MIN (0x8000) will be saturated to the maximum allowable positive value INT8_MAX.

briefdescription.para: Division of q63 inputs divided by a positive 32 bits.
Division of positive 64-bits inputs divided by a positive 32-bits.

detaileddescription.para:
*src
points to the input vector.
*dst
points to the output vector.
size
size of the vectors.
The Q31 value INT32_MIN (0x80000000) will be saturated to the maximum allowable positive value INT32_MAX.

*src
points to the input vector.
*dst
points to the output vector.
size
size of the vectors.
The Q15 value INT16_MIN (0x8000) will be saturated to the maximum allowable positive value INT16_MAX.

*src
points to the input vector.
*dst
points to the output vector.
size
size of the vectors.
The Q7 value INT8_MIN (0x80) will be saturated to the maximum allowable positive value INT8_MAX.

parameterdescription.para: points to the first input vector.
points to the second input vector.

simplesect.para: dot product of two input vectors.

detaileddescription.para:
*src1
points to the first input vector.
*src2
points to the second input vector.
size
size of the vectors.
dot product of two input vectors.
The output of multiplications is truncated from 2.62 to 2.48 format and then added without saturation to a 64-bit accumulator. The return value is in 16.48 format. When the size of the vectors less than 2^16, there is no risk to overflow.

*src1
points to the first input vector.
*src2
points to the second input vector.
size
size of the vectors.
dot product of two input vectors.
The output of multiplications is in 2.30 format and then added to a 64-bit accumulator in 34.30 format. The return value is in 34.30 format.

briefdescription.para: Dot production of u8 * q15 vectors.

detaileddescription.para:
*src1
points to the uint8_t format input vector.
*src2
points to the q15 format input vector.
size
size of the vectors.
dot product of two input vectors.
The output of multiplications is in 1.23 format and then added to an accumulator in 9.23 format. The return result is in 9.23 format.

*src1
points to the first input vector.
*src2
points to the second input vector.
size
size of the vectors.
dot product of two input vectors.
The output of multiplications is in 2.14 format and then added to an accumulator in 18.14 format. The return result is in 18.14 format.

briefdescription.para: Dot production of q7 * q15 vectors.

detaileddescription.para:
*src1
points to the q7_t format input vector.
*src2
points to the q15 format input vector.
size
size of the vectors.
dot product of two input vectors.
The output of multiplications is in 1.22 format and then added to an accumulator in 10.22 format. The return result is in 10.22 format.

*src1
points to the first input vector.
*src2
points to the second input vector.
size
size of the vectors.
dot product of two input vectors.
The output of multiplications is in 0.16 format and then added to an accumulator in 16.16 format. The return result is in 16.16 format.

parameterdescription.para: is the value to be added.

detaileddescription.para:
*src
points to the input vector.
offset
is the value to be added.
*dst
points to the output vector.
size
size of the vectors.
Output results are saturated in Q31 range [0x80000000 0x7FFFFFFF].

*src
points to the input vector.
offset
is the value to be added.
*dst
points to the output vector.
size
size of the vectors.
Output results are saturated in Q15 range [0x8000 0x7FFF].

*src
points to the input vector.
offset
is the value to be added.
*dst
points to the output vector.
size
size of the vectors.
Output results are saturated in Q7 range [0x80 0x7F].

*src
points to the input vector.
offset
is the value to be added.
*dst
points to the output vector.
size
size of the vectors.
Output results are saturated in U8 range [0x00 0xFF].

briefdescription.para: To multiply a floating-point vectors by a floating-point scale.

parameterdescription.para: is the value to be multiplied.

memberdef.argsstring: (q31_t *src, q31_t scalefract, int8_t shift, q31_t *dst, uint32_t size)
memberdef.name: hpm_dsp_scale_q31

briefdescription.para: To multiply a q31 vectors by a q31 scale.

detaileddescription.para:
*src
points to the input vector.
scalefract
is the fractional portion value to be multiplied.
shift
number of bits to shift.
*dst
points to the output vector.
size
size of the vectors.
These are multiplied to yield a 2.62 output and then is shift with saturation to 1.31 format.

memberdef.argsstring: (q15_t *src, q15_t scalefract, int8_t shift, q15_t *dst, uint32_t size)
memberdef.name: hpm_dsp_scale_q15

briefdescription.para: To multiply a q15 vectors by a q15 scale.

detaileddescription.para:
*src
points to the input vector.
scalefract
is the fractional portion value to be multiplied.
shift
number of bits to shift.
*dst
points to the output vector.
size
size of the vectors.
These are multiplied to yield a 2.30 output and then is shifted with saturation to 1.15 format.

memberdef.argsstring: (q7_t *src, q7_t scalefract, int8_t shift, q7_t *dst, uint32_t size)
memberdef.name: hpm_dsp_scale_q7

briefdescription.para: To multiply a q7 vectors by a q7 scale.

detaileddescription.para:
*src
points to the input vector.
scalefract
is the fractional portion value to be multiplied.
shift
number of bits to shift.
*dst
points to the output vector.
size
size of the vectors.
These are multiplied to yield a 2.14 output and then is shifted with saturation to 1.7 format.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t *src, q7_t scalefract, int8_t shift, uint8_t *dst, uint32_t size)
memberdef.name: hpm_dsp_scale_u8

briefdescription.para: To multiply a u8 vectors by a q7 scale.

detaileddescription.para:
*src
points to the input vector.
scalefract
is the fractional portion value to be multiplied.
shift
number of bits to shift.
*dst
points to the output vector.
size
size of the vectors.
The inputs are multiplied to yield a 1.15 output and then are shift with saturation to 8-bit formats.

briefdescription.para: Shifts a q15 vector with a specified shift number.

detaileddescription.para:
*src
the input vector.
shift
number of shift bits. If (shift > 0) means shifts left; (shift < 0) means shifts right.
*dst
the output vector.
size
size of the vectors.
The input and output are all saturated to q15 range [0x8000 0x7FFF].

briefdescription.para: Shifts a q31 vector with a specified shift number.

detaileddescription.para:
*src
the input vector.
shift
number of shift bits. If (shift > 0) means shifts left; (shift < 0) means shifts right.
*dst
the output vector.
size
size of the vectors.
The input and output are all saturated to q31 range [0x80000000 0x7FFFFFFF].

briefdescription.para: Shifts a q7 vector with a specified shift number.

detaileddescription.para:
*src
the input vector.
shift
number of shift bits. If (shift > 0) means shifts left; (shift < 0) means shifts right.
*dst
the output vector.
size
size of the vectors.
The input and output are all saturated to q7 range [0x80 0x7F].

briefdescription.para: Shifts a u8 vector for a specified shift number.

detaileddescription.para:
*src
the input vector.
shift
number of shift bits. If (shift > 0) means shifts left; (shift < 0) means shifts right.
*dst
the output vector.
size
size of the vectors.
The input and output are all saturated to u8 range [0x00 0xFF].
